document.heading: HOMESTEAD HOUSING PRESERVATION AMENDMENT ACT OF 1999

history.narrative: Law 13-11, the “Homestead Housing Preservation Amendment Act of 1999,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-50, which was referred to the Committee on Economic Development. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on February 2, 1999, and March 2, 1999, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on March 22, 1999, it was assigned Act No. 13-48 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-11 became effective on June 11, 1999.
